--- title: "4 - Evaluar modelos" subtitle: "Introducciendo Tidymodels" format: revealjs: slide-number: true footer: include-before-body: header.html include-after-body: footer-annotations.html theme: [default, tidymodels.scss] width: 1280 height: 720 knitr: opts_chunk: echo: true collapse: true comment: "#>" fig.path: "figures/" execute: eval: true --- ## Viendo las predicciones ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% relocate(propina, .pred_class, .pred_si, .pred_no) #> # A tibble: 8,000 Ã— 10 #> propina .pred_class .pred_si .pred_no distancia compania local dia mes #> #> 1 si si 0.967 0.0333 17.2 Chicago Inâ€¦ no Jue Feb #> 2 si si 0.935 0.0646 0.88 City Serviâ€¦ si Jue Mar #> 3 si si 0.967 0.0333 18.1 otra no Lun Feb #> 4 si si 0.949 0.0507 12.2 Chicago Inâ€¦ no Dom Mar #> 5 si si 0.821 0.179 0.94 Sun Taxi si Sab Abr #> 6 si si 0.967 0.0333 17.5 Flash Cab no Vie Mar #> 7 si si 0.967 0.0333 17.7 otra no Dom Ene #> 8 si si 0.938 0.0616 1.85 Taxicab Inâ€¦ no Vie Abr #> 9 si si 0.938 0.0616 0.53 Sun Taxi no Mar Mar #> 10 si si 0.931 0.0694 6.65 Taxicab Inâ€¦ no Dom Abr #> # â„¹ 7,990 more rows #> # â„¹ 1 more variable: hora ``` ::: ## Matriz de confusiÃ³n ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ![](images/matriz-confusion.png){width=800} ## Matriz de confusiÃ³n ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% conf_mat(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> Truth #> Prediction si no #> si 7341 536 #> no 43 80 ``` ::: ## Matriz de confusiÃ³n ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% conf_mat(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) %>% autoplot(type = "heatmap") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](figures/conf-mat-plot-1.svg) ::: ::: ## Mediciones de la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% accuracy(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.928 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/matriz-confusion-exactitud.png) ::: ::: ## El riesgo de concentrarse en la exactitud ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Hay que tener cuidado utilizando exactitud (`accuracy()`) ya que nos puede dar "buenos" resultado se predecimos con datos que no estÃ¡n balanceados ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% mutate(.pred_class = factor("si", levels = c("si", "no"))) %>% accuracy(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.923 ``` ::: ## Mediciones de la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% sensitivity(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 sensitivity binary 0.994 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/matriz-confusion-sensibilidad.png) ::: ::: ## Mediciones de la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3-6"} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% sensitivity(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 sensitivity binary 0.994 ``` :::
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% specificity(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 specificity binary 0.130 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/matriz-confusion-especificidad.png) ::: ::: ## Mediciones de la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Para combinar multiples cÃ¡lculos en una tabla, usa `metric_set()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_metrics <- metric_set(accuracy, specificity, sensitivity) augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% taxi_metrics(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.928 #> 2 specificity binary 0.130 #> 3 sensitivity binary 0.994 ``` ::: ## Mediciones de la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_metrics <- metric_set(accuracy, specificity, sensitivity) augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% group_by(local) %>% taxi_metrics(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 6 Ã— 4 #> local .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 si accuracy binary 0.898 #> 2 no accuracy binary 0.935 #> 3 si specificity binary 0.169 #> 4 no specificity binary 0.116 #> 5 si sensitivity binary 0.987 #> 6 no sensitivity binary 0.996 ``` ::: ## Resultados de dos clases Estas mÃ©tricas asumen que sabemos cual es lÃ­mite para convertir probabilidades de predicciÃ³n "suaves" a prediciones de clase "duras" . . . Â¿Es bueno un lÃ­mite de 50%? Â¿Que pasarÃ­a si lo cambiamos a 80%? - sensibilidad â¬‡ï¸, especificidad â¬†ï¸ . . . Â¿Y si lo cambiamos a 20%? - sensibilidad â¬†ï¸, especificidad â¬‡ï¸ ## Varying the threshold ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](figures/thresholds-1.svg) ::: ::: ## Curvas ROC Para crear una "curva ROC", osea una curva de *caracterÃ­stica operativa del receptor* hacemos lo siguiente: - Calcular la sensibilidad y especificidad de todos los lÃ­mites posibles - GrÃ¡ficar los falsos positivos en el axis X, contra los positivos verdaderos en el axis Y. Ya que la sensibilidad es la proporciÃ³n de positivos verdaderos, y la especificidad es la de los negativos verdaderos, entonces `1 - especificidad` es la proporciÃ³n de los falsos positivos. . . . Podemos usar el **area debajo de la curva** (AUC = area under de curve) ROC como una mÃ©trica de clasificaciÃ³n: - ROC AUC = 1 ğŸ’¯ - ROC AUC = 1/2 ğŸ˜¢ :::notes ROC curves are insensitive to class imbalance. ::: ## Curvas ROC ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Assumes _first_ factor level is event; there are options to change that augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% roc_curve(truth = propina, .pred_si) %>% slice(1, 20, 50) #> # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 #> .threshold specificity sensitivity #> #> 1 -Inf 0 1 #> 2 0.783 0.209 0.981 #> 3 1 1 0.00135 augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% roc_auc(truth = propina, .pred_si) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 roc_auc binary 0.691 ``` ::: ## GrÃ¡fica de curvas ROC ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell output-location='column'} ```{.r .cell-code} augment(taxi_ajustado, new_data = taxi_entrenar) %>% roc_curve(truth = propina, .pred_si) %>% autoplot() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](figures/roc-curve-1.svg) ::: ::: ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} *Calcule y grÃ¡fique una curva ROC con su modelo* *Â¿Cuales son los datos que se utilizaron para esta curva ROC?* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: ::: ## {background-iframe="https://yardstick.tidymodels.org/reference/index.html"} ::: footer ::: # âš ï¸ LOS PELIGROS DEL SOBREAJUSTAR âš ï¸ ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/topepo/2022-nyr-workshop/main/images/tuning-overfitting-train-1.svg) ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/topepo/2022-nyr-workshop/main/images/tuning-overfitting-test-1.svg) ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_entrenar) #> # A tibble: 8,000 Ã— 10 #> .pred_class .pred_si .pred_no propina distancia compania local dia mes #> #> 1 si 0.967 0.0333 si 17.2 Chicago Inâ€¦ no Jue Feb #> 2 si 0.935 0.0646 si 0.88 City Serviâ€¦ si Jue Mar #> 3 si 0.967 0.0333 si 18.1 otra no Lun Feb #> 4 si 0.949 0.0507 si 12.2 Chicago Inâ€¦ no Dom Mar #> 5 si 0.821 0.179 si 0.94 Sun Taxi si Sab Abr #> 6 si 0.967 0.0333 si 17.5 Flash Cab no Vie Mar #> 7 si 0.967 0.0333 si 17.7 otra no Dom Ene #> 8 si 0.938 0.0616 si 1.85 Taxicab Inâ€¦ no Vie Abr #> 9 si 0.938 0.0616 si 0.53 Sun Taxi no Mar Mar #> 10 si 0.931 0.0694 si 6.65 Taxicab Inâ€¦ no Dom Abr #> # â„¹ 7,990 more rows #> # â„¹ 1 more variable: hora ``` ::: A esto le llamamos "resubstituciÃ³n" Ã³ "repredecir en los datos de entrenamiento" ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_entrenar) %>% accuracy(propina, .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.928 ``` ::: A esto le llamamos "resubstituciÃ³n de la estimaciÃ³n" ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_entrenar) %>% accuracy(propina, .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.928 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: ::: ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_entrenar) %>% accuracy(propina, .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.928 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_prueba) %>% accuracy(propina, .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.908 ``` ::: ::: ::: . . . âš ï¸ Acuerdate que estamos demonstrando el sobreajuste . . . âš ï¸ No utilizes el set the prueba sino hasta el *fin* de tu analisis ## "Ja-ja-ja, estoy en peligro" {background-image="https://media.giphy.com/media/55itGuoAJiZEEen9gg/giphy.gif" background-size="70%"} ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute bottom="0" left="0" width="150" height="150"} *Usa `augment()` y una funciÃ³n de mÃ©trica para calcular una mÃ©trica de classificaciÃ³n, por ejemplo `brier_class()`* *Calcula las mÃ©tricas para los datos de entrenamiento y de prueba para demonstrar el sobreajuste* *Nota la evidencia de sobreajuste* âš ï¸ ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: ::: ## Los peligros del sobreajustar âš ï¸ ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_entrenar) %>% brier_class(propina, .pred_si) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 brier_class binary 0.0632 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_ajustado %>% augment(taxi_prueba) %>% brier_class(propina, .pred_si) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 #> .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 brier_class binary 0.0782 ``` ::: ::: ::: . . . Â¿Que tal si queremos comparar mÃ¡s modelos? . . . ...y comparar configuraciones para los modelos? . . . Y tambien queremos saber si las diferencias son importantes # Los datos de prueba son valiosos ğŸ’ # Â¿Como podrÃ­amos usar los datos de entrenamiento para comparar y evaluar varios modelos? ## Remuestreo ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart TD ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rm1[Remuestreo 1] style rm1 fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rm1 rm2[Remuestreo 2] style rm2 fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rm2 rm3[Remuestreo B] style rm3 fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rm3 an1[Analysis] style an1 fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm1 --> an1 vl1[ValidaciÃ³n] style vl1 fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm1 --> vl1 an2[Analysis] style an2 fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm2 --> an2 vl2[ValidaciÃ³n] style vl2 fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm2 --> vl2 an3[Analysis] style an3 fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm3 --> an3 vl3[ValidaciÃ³n] style vl3 fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 rm3 --> vl3 ``` ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](https://www.tmwr.org/premade/three-CV.svg) ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](images/cv-spanish.png) ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} *Si usamos 10 plieges (folds), cual es el porcentaje de datos de entrenamiento* - *cuantos terminan en anÃ¡lisis* - *cuantos terminan en evaluaciÃ³n (assesment)* *...para **cada** pliege?* ![](images/taxi_spinning.svg){width="300"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
03:00
``` ::: ::: ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vfold_cv(taxi_entrenar) #> # 10-fold cross-validation #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Â¿Que hay en este? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_plieges <- vfold_cv(taxi_entrenar) taxi_plieges$splits[1:3] #> [[1]] #> #> <7200/800/8000> #> #> [[2]] #> #> <7200/800/8000> #> #> [[3]] #> #> <7200/800/8000> ``` ::: ::: notes Talk about a list column, storing non-atomic types in dataframe ::: ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vfold_cv(taxi_entrenar, v = 5) #> # 5-fold cross-validation #> # A tibble: 5 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Fold1 #> 2 Fold2 #> 3 Fold3 #> 4 Fold4 #> 5 Fold5 ``` ::: ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vfold_cv(taxi_entrenar, strata = propina) #> # 10-fold cross-validation using stratification #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: . . . Estratificar usualmente ayuda, y con pocos malas consecuencias ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Usaremos esto: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(123) taxi_plieges <- vfold_cv(taxi_entrenar, v = 10, strata = propina) taxi_plieges #> # 10-fold cross-validation using stratification #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: . . . Especifica la semilla (seed) cuando estas creando remuestreos # Estamos equipados con mÃ©tricas y remuestreos ## Ajustemos nuestro modelo usando los remuestreos ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_res <- fit_resamples(arbol_flujo, taxi_plieges) taxi_res #> # Resampling results #> # 10-fold cross-validation using stratification #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 4 #> splits id .metrics .notes #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: ## Evaluando la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_res %>% collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 6 #> .metric .estimator mean n std_err .config #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.915 10 0.00309 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc binary 0.624 10 0.0105 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: ::: notes `collect_metrics()` is one of a suite of `collect_*()` functions that can be used to work with columns of tuning results. Most columns in a tuning result prefixed with `.` have a corresponding `collect_*()` function with options for common summaries. ::: . . . Podemos medir correctamente la la calidad del modelo usando solo los datos de entrenamiento ğŸ‰ ## Comparando las mÃ©tricas ![](hexes/yardstick.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Â¿Que diferencia hay entre las mÃ©tricas usando los datos de remuestreo, y usando los datos de entrenamiento y prueba? ::: {.cell} ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_res %>% collect_metrics() %>% select(.metric, mean, n) #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 3 #> .metric mean n #> #> 1 accuracy 0.915 10 #> 2 roc_auc 0.624 10 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} El ROC AUC antes era: - 0.69 para el set the entrenamiento - 0.64 para el set the prueba ::: ::: . . . Acuerdate que: âš ï¸ Los datos de entrenamiento da mÃ©tricas demasiado optimÃ­sticas âš ï¸ Los datos de prueba son valiosos ## Evaluando la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ctrl_taxi <- control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE) taxi_res <- fit_resamples(arbol_flujo, taxi_plieges, control = ctrl_taxi) taxi_res #> # Resampling results #> # 10-fold cross-validation using stratification #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5 #> splits id .metrics .notes .predictions #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: ## Evaluando la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Guarde los resultados de las evaluaciones taxi_preds <- collect_predictions(taxi_res) taxi_preds #> # A tibble: 8,000 Ã— 7 #> id .pred_si .pred_no .row .pred_class propina .config #> #> 1 Fold01 0.938 0.0615 14 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 Fold01 0.946 0.0544 19 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 Fold01 0.973 0.0269 33 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 4 Fold01 0.903 0.0971 43 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 5 Fold01 0.973 0.0269 74 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 6 Fold01 0.903 0.0971 103 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 7 Fold01 0.915 0.0851 104 si no Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 8 Fold01 0.903 0.0971 124 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 9 Fold01 0.667 0.333 126 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 10 Fold01 0.949 0.0510 128 si si Preprocessor1_Model1 #> # â„¹ 7,990 more rows ``` ::: ## Evaluando la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_preds %>% group_by(id) %>% taxi_metrics(truth = propina, estimate = .pred_class) #> # A tibble: 30 Ã— 4 #> id .metric .estimator .estimate #> #> 1 Fold01 accuracy binary 0.905 #> 2 Fold02 accuracy binary 0.925 #> 3 Fold03 accuracy binary 0.926 #> 4 Fold04 accuracy binary 0.915 #> 5 Fold05 accuracy binary 0.902 #> 6 Fold06 accuracy binary 0.912 #> 7 Fold07 accuracy binary 0.906 #> 8 Fold08 accuracy binary 0.91 #> 9 Fold09 accuracy binary 0.918 #> 10 Fold10 accuracy binary 0.931 #> # â„¹ 20 more rows ``` ::: ## Â¿Donde estan los modelos que ajustamos? ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} {.annotation} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxi_res #> # Resampling results #> # 10-fold cross-validation using stratification #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5 #> splits id .metrics .notes .predictions #> #> 1 Fold01 #> 2 Fold02 #> 3 Fold03 #> 4 Fold04 #> 5 Fold05 #> 6 Fold06 #> 7 Fold07 #> 8 Fold08 #> 9 Fold09 #> 10 Fold10 ``` ::: . . . ğŸ—‘ï¸ # Otros mÃ©todos de remuestreo ## Bootstrapping ![](images/bootstraps-spanish.png) ## Bootstrapping ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(3214) bootstraps(taxi_entrenar) #> # Bootstrap sampling #> # A tibble: 25 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Bootstrap01 #> 2 Bootstrap02 #> 3 Bootstrap03 #> 4 Bootstrap04 #> 5 Bootstrap05 #> 6 Bootstrap06 #> 7 Bootstrap07 #> 8 Bootstrap08 #> 9 Bootstrap09 #> 10 Bootstrap10 #> # â„¹ 15 more rows ``` ::: ## {background-iframe="https://rsample.tidymodels.org/reference/index.html"} ::: footer ::: ## Expectativas del taller - Donde estamos ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestras] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#fff,stroke:#eee,color:#ddd lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm fm[Entrenar modelo\nselecionado] style fm fill:#fff,stroke:#eee,color:#ddd sm --> fm tr --> fm vm[Verificar la\ncalidad] style vm fill:#fff,stroke:#eee,color:#ddd fm --> vm ts --> vm ``` ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} *Crea un:* - *Set de validaciÃ³n cruzada tipo Monte Carlo* - *Set de validaciÃ³n* *No te olvides de usar `set.seed()`* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: ::: ## ValidaciÃ³n cruzada tipo Monte Carlo ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(322) mc_cv(taxi_entrenar, times = 10) #> # Monte Carlo cross-validation (0.75/0.25) with 10 resamples #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 Resample01 #> 2 Resample02 #> 3 Resample03 #> 4 Resample04 #> 5 Resample05 #> 6 Resample06 #> 7 Resample07 #> 8 Resample08 #> 9 Resample09 #> 10 Resample10 ``` ::: ## Set de validaciÃ³n ![](hexes/rsample.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(853) taxi_val_split <- initial_validation_split(taxi, strata = propina) validation_set(taxi_val_split) #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 2 #> splits id #> #> 1 validation ``` ::: . . . Un set de validaciÃ³n es solamente otro tipo de remuestreo # Arbol de decisiÃ³n ğŸŒ³ # Bosque aleatorio ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ´ğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ğŸŒµğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ´ğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ´ğŸŒµğŸŒ²ğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒµğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ ## Bosque aleatorio ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ´ğŸŒµğŸŒ³ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ²ğŸŒµğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ğŸŒµ - Ensambla varios Ã¡rboles de decisiÃ³n - Â¡Todos los Ã¡rboles votan! ğŸ—³ï¸ - AgregaciÃ³n tipo bootstrap + muestreo aleatorio del predictor . . . - Usualmente funciona bien sin usar afinamiento, pero solo mientras hayan suficientes Ã¡rboles ## Crear un modelo de bosque aleatorio ![](hexes/parsnip.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} rf_spec <- rand_forest(trees = 1000, mode = "classification") rf_spec #> Random Forest Model Specification (classification) #> #> Main Arguments: #> trees = 1000 #> #> Computational engine: ranger ``` ::: ## Crear un modelo de bosque aleatorio ![](hexes/workflows.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} rf_wflow <- workflow(propina ~ ., rf_spec) rf_wflow #> â•â• Workflow â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• #> Preprocessor: Formula #> Model: rand_forest() #> #> â”€â”€ Preprocessor â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> propina ~ . #> #> â”€â”€ Model â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> Random Forest Model Specification (classification) #> #> Main Arguments: #> trees = 1000 #> #> Computational engine: ranger ``` ::: ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} *Usa `fit_resamples()` y `rf_wflow` para lo siguiente:* - *Quedarse con las predicciones* - *Calcular las mÃ©tricas* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
08:00
``` ::: ::: ## Evaluando la calidad del modelo ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ctrl_taxi <- control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE) # Bosque aleatorio usan numeros al azar, asi que asegurate de definir la semilla set.seed(2) rf_res <- fit_resamples(rf_wflow, taxi_plieges, control = ctrl_taxi) collect_metrics(rf_res) #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 6 #> .metric .estimator mean n std_err .config #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.924 10 0.00323 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc binary 0.611 10 0.0149 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: ## Expectativas del taller - Donde estamos ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestras] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm fm[Entrenar modelo\nselecionado] style fm fill:#fff,stroke:#eee,color:#ddd sm --> fm tr --> fm vm[Verificar la\ncalidad] style vm fill:#fff,stroke:#eee,color:#ddd fm --> vm ts --> vm ``` ## El ajuste final ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} Digamos que estamos satisfechos con usar nuestro modelo de bosque aleatorio Ajustemos el modelo usando todos los datos en el set the entrenamiento, y despues midamos la calidad del modelo con el set the prueba . . . Hemos usado `fit()` y `predict()` (+ `augment()`), pero hay un atajo: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # taxi_separar has train + test info ajuste_final <- last_fit(rf_wflow, taxi_separar) ajuste_final #> # Resampling results #> # Manual resampling #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 6 #> splits id .metrics .notes .predictions .workflow #> #> 1 train/test split ``` ::: ## Â¿Que contiene `ajuste_final`? ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} collect_metrics(ajuste_final) #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 4 #> .metric .estimator .estimate .config #> #> 1 accuracy binary 0.914 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc binary 0.630 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: . . . Las mÃ©tricas fueron calculadas con el set de **prueba** ## Â¿Que contiene `ajuste_final`? ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} collect_predictions(ajuste_final) #> # A tibble: 2,000 Ã— 7 #> id .pred_si .pred_no .row .pred_class propina .config #> #> 1 train/test split 0.949 0.0513 4 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 2 train/test split 0.922 0.0777 10 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 3 train/test split 0.961 0.0395 19 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 4 train/test split 0.889 0.111 23 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 5 train/test split 0.936 0.0639 28 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 6 train/test split 0.969 0.0306 34 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 7 train/test split 0.962 0.0377 35 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 8 train/test split 0.939 0.0606 38 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 9 train/test split 0.986 0.0138 40 si si Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> 10 train/test split 0.957 0.0431 42 si no Preprocessor1_Mâ€¦ #> # â„¹ 1,990 more rows ``` ::: ## Â¿Que contiene `ajuste_final`? ![](hexes/tune.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} extract_workflow(ajuste_final) #> â•â• Workflow [trained] â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• #> Preprocessor: Formula #> Model: rand_forest() #> #> â”€â”€ Preprocessor â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> propina ~ . #> #> â”€â”€ Model â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> Ranger result #> #> Call: #> ranger::ranger(x = maybe_data_frame(x), y = y, num.trees = ~1000, num.threads = 1, verbose = FALSE, seed = sample.int(10^5, 1), probability = TRUE) #> #> Type: Probability estimation #> Number of trees: 1000 #> Sample size: 8000 #> Number of independent variables: 6 #> Mtry: 2 #> Target node size: 10 #> Variable importance mode: none #> Splitrule: gini #> OOB prediction error (Brier s.): 0.07070342 ``` ::: . . . Use this for **prediction** on new data, like for deploying ## Expectativas del taller - Â¡Ya llegamos! ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestreo] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm fm[Entrenar modelo\nselecionado] style fm fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 sm --> fm tr --> fm vm[Verificar la\ncalidad] style vm fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 fm --> vm ts --> vm ```

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
